caseTitle: Mst. Shahnaz Akhtar & another v. Syed Ehsan ur Rehman & others
tagline: (1) Discussion on Article 117, 95, 79 and 129 of Qanun-e-Shahadat Order 1984. (2) Section 32 and 33 of Registration Act. (3). Section 2 of Power of Attorney Act 1882 & Section 202 of Contract Act. The power of attorney should be construed strictly. The principal may revoke the power of attorney at any time unless it is with consideration. (4) Word surrender presupposes the possession or ownership of thing that is to be given up which may be expressed or implied whereas a release is the giving or discharging of a right of action.
